Event.name: Disembarking
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Traveller</fen> leaves from or dismounts a <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
<ex><fex name="tra">The passengers</fex> <t>disembarked</t> <fex name="pla">in Southampton</fex>.</ex>
<ex>They then informed the passengers that, if the aircraft were to leave the runway, <fex name="tra">they</fex> would likely be <t>deplaning</t> <fex name="Path">through the rear cabin doors</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Traveller
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Traveller</fen> is the entity which disembarks from the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
<ex><fex name="tra">We</fex> <t>got</t> off at the wrong bus stop.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Vehicle</fen> is the means of conveyance that the <fen>Traveller</fen> disembarks from.
<ex>The victim stopped the tractor and <t>dismounted</t> <fex name="Vehicle">from it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> describes a property of the motion not related to its trajectory. </def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> describes the trajectory of the <fen>Traveller</fen>'s motion off or out of the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
<ex>As we <t>got</t> off the plane <fex name="Path">via a set of steps</fex> we were immediately guided into a bus.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration_of_final_state
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time the <fen>Traveller</fen> spends off or outside of the <fen>Vehicle</fen> after disembarking from it. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Traveller</fen> or <fen>Vehicle</fen> during the disembarking. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>When the disembarking of the <fen>Vehicle</fen> takes place.
<ex><fex name="Time">Yesterday</fex>, we <t>alighted</t> onto this tiny hilly island, site of a Singaporean October festival.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cotheme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A theme that leaves the <fen>Vehicle</fen> together with the main <fen>Traveller</fen>. This may be an entity the <fen>Traveller</fen> transports or a co-traveller moving under their own power.
<ex>Many people were waiting for him when he <t>got</t> off the ship <fex name="CT">with his wife, Estelita Villafane</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Traveller</fen> disembarks from the vehicle. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location in which the <fen>Traveller</fen> disembarks from the <fen>Vehicle</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location that the <fen>Traveller</fen> reaches by leaving the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
<ex>The driver and the majority of passengers <t>dismounted</t> <fex name="goa">onto the road</fex> as onlookers quickly formed an unruly squabbling mass.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: disembark.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: leave a vehicle, usually a ship, aircraft, or train.

lexUnit.name: debark.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: leave a ship or aircraft.

lexUnit.name: detrain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: leave a train, or cause or assist to leave a train.

lexUnit.name: dismount.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: alight, usually from a horse or bike.

lexUnit.name: debus.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: alight from a motor vehicle

lexUnit.name: disembarkation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of getting off a ship, aircraft, or train
